title: Bambi Northwood-Blyth transforms into Catwoman for a photoshoot ahead of Halloween
text:
She's the globe-trotting model who knows how to work a camera.

And on Wednesday, Bambi Northwood-Blyth, 28, transformed into DC comics character Catwoman for an edgy photoshoot.

The Australian beauty took to Instagram to share a snap of herself looking almost unrecognisable as the feline anti-heroine, clad in a latex suit and holding a hairless cat.

Picture purr-fect! Bambi Northwood-Blyth looked almost unrecognisable as she transformed into DC comics character Catwoman for a photoshoot on Wednesday, ahead of Halloween

The brunette beauty could be seen carrying a Sphynx cat as she posed for the camera, showing off her glossy red lip, brushed up brows and bold smokey eye look.

She also wears a short blonde wig.

Bambi penned in the caption: 'CATWOMAN come through.'

She continued: 'It's about to be Halloween, time to bring her back?' before tagging a makeup artist.

Making a move: The stunning Australian model is renowned for her natural beauty, and is now based in New York

Back in September meanwhile, she marked a new career milestone - appearing on the cover of Elle Mexico's September issue.

Taking to Instagram at the time, the stunner shared a snap of the cover, alongside the caption: 'Smiles all around for the new September Cover Issue of Elle.'

Fans were quick to comment on Bambi's cover, with one person writing: 'In this photo I can see your beautiful smile and your wonderful eyes.'

She glowing! Bambi looks ethereal in in a ruffled tangerine blouse and silk gloves as she posed on the cover of Elle Mexico

'Congratulations!! Look at you on a red fluffy dress!! Super Sassy and Cheerful!! Best wishes to you this season!!' another follower enthused.

Aside from being a successful model, Bambi is also known for her candid approach to documenting her experience living with Type 1 diabetes.

Taking to Instagram in May, the model documented herself testing out a new glucose monitoring system to manage her Type 1 diabetes.
description: She's the globe-trotting model who knows how to work a camera.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
